mods.abstract: Pre-Columbian Valdivia figurine with eleven incised lines total on the ridged face of the figure three coming diagonally from the rounded top and eight horizontal around the ridge (four on each side). Two pointed protrusions extend from the presumed bottom of the figure and two smaller bump like protrusions extend perpendicular from around the middle of the figure. "Vadivia Fase B" written on the back.
Overall good condition. Evidence that one of the pointed protrusions had broken off and been glued back together. Looks as if it was once fully painted but has since severely faded or chipped off.

titleInfo.title: Pre-Columbian figurines
Pre-Columbian cultural artifacts
George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts
